title: People We Should Invite to America
sub_head: Biden and Harris still don’t appreciate the historic opportunity to recruit talent.
body:
Vice President Kamala Harris should be forgiven for her inopportune case of the giggles during a discussion of Ukrainian refugees two weeks ago. But it’s harder to get past Biden administration policy, which continues to suggest that the president and the vice president really don’t take this issue seriously. They are missing out on a huge opportunity to do good in the world and to do well for the United States.
Two weeks after President Andrzej Duda of Poland explained in detail to Ms. Harris how the flood of refugees is overwhelming his country, the United States is still only willing to accept a tiny fraction of those fleeing the war zone. The Journal’s Catherine Lucey and Laurence Norman report:
